definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: They have cooked and compared North and South Korean dishes.
sentences.chinese: 一起做菜，對比朝鮮和韓國菜。

sentences.english: One third of the pawpaw is for the dish, the remainder is for you.
sentences.chinese: 這個木瓜三分之一用來做菜，其餘的都是你的啦。

sentences.english: Seth ended up cutting his finger while cooking.
sentences.chinese: 賽斯做菜時結果割到自己的手指。

sentences.english: Where did he learn to cook this way?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎麼學會這樣做菜的呢？

sentences.english: My mother is health-conscious and prepares food with little MSG and salt.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽非常注意飲食健康，做菜時放很少的味精和鹽。

sentences.english: Creative gadgets and inventions designed for people who love to cook.
sentences.chinese: 爲熱愛做菜的人設計的創意小工具和小發明。

sentences.english: People started to thank her and cook her meals.
sentences.chinese: 人們開始感謝她，照着她的食譜做菜。

sentences.english: If you are not into picnics then cook her dinner.
sentences.chinese: 如果你沒準備野餐就爲她做菜吧。

sentences.english: She likes flavouring dishes with chili oil.
sentences.chinese: 她做菜很喜歡用辣椒油調味。

sentences.english: A man that can cook is really sexy.
sentences.chinese: 會做菜的男人真的很性感。

sentences.english: Life can not cook, all the materials are ready was the pot.
sentences.chinese: 人生不能像做菜，把所有的料都準備好才下鍋。

sentences.english: I always learn to cook by using recipes, but I'm still a poor cook.
sentences.chinese: 我總是靠菜譜來學烹飪，但至今我做菜還是很差。

sentences.english: She was a good cook, she had learned that from her mother.
sentences.chinese: 做菜，她是一把好手，這是她從媽媽那裏學來的。

sentences.english: She is a good housekeeper, not to speak of being a good cook.
sentences.chinese: 她不但是一個做菜的能手，而且很會治家。

sentences.english: I like to cook dishes with cabbage .
I almost never cook with it.
sentences.chinese: 我幾乎從來不用魚皮做菜。

definition: to stir-fry/to do the cooking/stir-fried dish
to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
to simmer/soup made by simmering for a long time
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
to be in charge of the cooking/to be the chef/head cook/chef
